thread.title: 6 High-Protein Salads That Have No Chicken Whatsoever
thread.title_full: 6 High-Protein Salads That Have No Chicken Whatsoever | Prevention

author: Marygrace Taylor
title: 6 High-Protein Salads That Have No Chicken Whatsoever
text:
You've been dutifully eating grilled chicken salad for lunch since as far back as you can remember, because it's clean, easy, and loaded with protein . But let's face it: It's gotten boring as heck.
Folks, it's time to give the seared poultry a break. Fortunately, trying something new doesn't mean that your nutritional standards have to get tossed by the wayside. These tasty, chicken-free salads are just as high in protein—and they'll make your tired taste buds much happier. (Repeat after us: No more dieting. Ever. Instead, learn how to eat clean—with zero deprivation!—and watch the pounds drop off, with Your Metabolism Makeover .)

Quinoa and kale protein power salad 1/6 Photograph courtesy of Foodie Crush Quinoa and kale protein power salad Foodie Crush 's superfood salad might be vegan , but it packs a serious protein punch, thanks to plant-based powerhouses like chickpeas , quinoa, and crunchy pistachio nuts. And with unexpected flavor boosters like clementines, pomegranate seeds, orange juice, and mint leaves, it's way more fun than the typical kale salads you'll find at the market salad bar.
See how to deseed a pomegranate:
BLT salmon salad with avocado green goddess dressing 2/6 Photograph courtesy of Heather Christo BLT salmon salad with avocado green goddess dressing Found: A clean, satisfying alternative to your favorite splurge sandwich and your usual grilled chicken salad. Heather Christo tops peppery arugula with seared salmon fillets (which serve up 16g protein per 3-ounce serving), crispy bacon, cherry tomatoes, avocado, plus more avocado in a creamy, herb-infused dressing. If you kind of want to lick the screen right now, we don't blame you. ( Just make sure you read this before you buy your next salmon fillet .)
Tempeh black bean taco salad 3/6 Photograph courtesy of Cafe Johnsonia Tempeh black bean taco salad Tempeh—a fermented soybean cake—is a delicious and under-utilized source of protein . With 31g per one-cup serving, it packs more protein than a 3-ounce chicken breast. Do like Café Johnsonia and marinate it in a mixture of lime juice, maple syrup, liquid smoke, and spices. Then, toss it with chopped romaine, black beans, avocado , and salsa for a tasty Tex-Mex inspired salad.
Lemony-garlic white bean salad with hemp seed pesto 4/6 Photograph courtesy of blissful basil Lemony-garlic white bean salad with hemp seed pesto When you're craving pesto but you know the answer for lunch definitely isn't pasta, make Blissful Basil 's salad instead. The creamy, high-protein white beans are soft and velvety, making a satisfying stand-in for the usual pasta. Plus, this basil pesto is made with protein-rich hemp seeds .
MORE: Top 10 Cholesterol-Fighting Foods
Grilled steak salad with rainbow roasted vegetables 5/6 Photograph courtesy of well plated Grilled steak salad with rainbow roasted vegetables Steak might not be your go-to lunchtime protein. But when you pair seared sirloin with roasted root vegetables , crisp arugula, chopped pistachios, and crumbled blue cheese like Well Plated , the results aren't just mouthwatering. They're totally appropriate for a midday meal.
Loaded lentil salad 6/6 Photograph courtesy of Hummusapien Loaded lentil salad At 18g protein and 16g fiber per one-cup serving, it's no secret that lentils are really good for you. But how to make them also taste great? Take a cue from Hummusapien 's playbook and toss them with roasted sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, high-protein pumpkin seeds , and a maple balsamic dressing. The humble legumes never tasted so fantastic.
